sen.j: 大興寺（だいこうじ）は、京都府福知山市正明寺（しょうみょうじ）にある臨済宗の寺院。
sen.e: Daikoji Temple is a temple of the Rinzai sect of Buddhism located in Shomyoji, Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Daikoji Temple is a temple of the Rinzai sect of Buddhism located in Shomyoji, Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Daiko-ji Temple is a temple of the Rinzai Sect of Buddhism located in Shomyoji, Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: Daiko-ji Templeに修正、sectの頭文字を大文字に変更

sen.j: 山号は雲龍山。
sen.e: The mountain associated with the temple is Mt. Uryu.
The mountain associated with the temple is Mt. Uryu.
The mountain associated with the temple is Mt. Unryu.

sen.j: 寺に関する記録がありませんが、大興寺より以前に正明寺という寺が、平安時代に存在しており、歌が残っています。
sen.e: There are no records relating to the temple. However, poems remain about a Heian period temple called Shomyoji Temple which existed prior to Daikoji Temple.
There are no records relating to the temple. However, poems remain about a Heian period temple called Shomyoji Temple which existed prior to Daikoji Temple.
There are no records relating to the temple; however, poems remain about a Heian period temple called Shomyo-ji Temple which existed prior to Daiko-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 二文に分かれているため一文になるよう修正、Shomyo-ji Temple、Daiko-ji Templeとしました。

sen.j: 「見開けば 法の声する正明寺 ものさびしきは 小野脇の里」
sen.e: "Awakened to chanting from Shomyoji Temple, how I long for the Onowaki village."
"Awakened to chanting from Shomyoji Temple, how I long for the Onowaki village."
Awakened to chanting from Shomyo-ji Temple, how I long for the Onowaki village.'
sen.cmt: クォーテーションをシングル・半角に修正、Shomyo-ji Templeとしました。

sen.j: 近くに小野小町が病となり、温泉に入り快癒したという「小野脇」があり、小野小町伝説がある。
sen.e: It is said that there is a legend about the poet Komachi ONO: where Komachi ONO had fallen ill and to convalesce took to bathing at "Onowaki ", a nearby hot spring.
It is said that there is a legend about the poet Komachi ONO: where Komachi ONO had fallen ill and to convalesce took to bathing at "Onowaki ", a nearby hot spring.
It is said that there is a legend about the poet ONO no Komachi: where Komachi ONO had fallen ill and to convalesce took to bathing at 'Onowaki,' a nearby hot spring.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションをシングル・半角に修正、カンマの位置を移動、スペース削除、Komachi ONO→ONO no Komachiとしました。

sen.j: 正明寺という寺について
sen.e: Shomyoji Temple:
Shomyoji Temple:
Shomyo-ji Temple:

sen.j: 真言宗の正明寺という寺の他に、2ケ寺あったと云われ、村の人は寺荘を耕作して暮らしていたといわれています。
sen.e: Besides Shomyoji Temple of the Shingon Sect of Buddhism, mention is made of 2 other temples where it is said local village folk made their livings by cultivating temple grounds.
Besides Shomyoji Temple of the Shingon Sect of Buddhism, mention is made of 2 other temples where it is said local village folk made their livings by cultivating temple grounds.
Besides Shomyo-ji Temple of the Shingon Sect of Buddhism, mention is made of two other temples where it is said local village folk made their livings by cultivating temple grounds.
sen.cmt: Shomyo-ji Templeとし、"2"をスペルアウト

sen.j: その後寺は荒廃しました。
sen.e: Later on the temple fell into ruin.
Later on the temple fell into ruin.
Later on the temple fell into ruin.

sen.j: 寛永8年 1631年現在の地に開山幽玄相林和尚を請じて大興寺を建立し、臨済宗南禅寺派に属し現在27世今に至っている。
sen.e: In 1631, with the arrival of the first chief priest (High Priest Yugen Shorin), Daikoji Temple was built in the present location, affiliated with the Nanzenji Temple branch of the Rinzai sect of Buddhism and, has been passed down 27 generations to the present day.

In 1631, with the arrival of the first chief priest (High Priest Yugen Shorin), Daikoji Temple was built in the present location, affiliated with the Nanzenji Temple branch of the Rinzai sect of Buddhism and, has been passed down 27 generations to the present day.

In 1631, with the arrival of the first chief priest (High Priest Yugen Shorin), Daiko-ji Temple was built in the present location, affiliated with the Nanzen-ji School of the Rinzai Sect and, has been passed down 27 generations to the present day.
sen.cmt: Daiko-ji Templeに修正、「臨済宗南禅寺派」の表記を修正

sen.j: 本尊は阿弥陀如来
sen.e: The principal object of worship at the temple is the Amida Nyorai (statue of Amitabha Tathagata).
The principal object of worship at the temple is the Amida Nyorai (statue of Amitabha Tathagata).
The principal object of worship at the temple is the Amida Nyorai (statue of Amitabha Tathagata).

sen.j: 現在は境内にモリアオガエルが生息、産卵。
sen.e: Currently, the forest green tree frog (Rhacophorus arboreus) inhabits and spawns in the temple precinct.
Currently, the forest green tree frog (Rhacophorus arboreus) inhabits and spawns in the temple precinct.
Currently, the forest green tree frog (Rhacophorus arboreus) inhabits and spawns in the temple precincts.

sen.j: 住職の有賀祖道師が、モリアオガエルを保護、観察を行っている。
sen.e: Chief priest His Holiness Sodo ARUGA protects and observes the forest green tree frog.
Chief priest His Holiness Sodo ARUGA protects and observes the forest green tree frog.
Chief priest His Holiness Sodo ARUGA protects and observes the forest green tree frog.

sen.j: 平成9年より、モリアオガエル観察のホ－ムペ－ジを立ち上げている。
sen.e: Since 1997 he has maintained a Forest Green Tree Frog observation web site. Local folk are fond of the temple which also goes by the popular names "Green Forest Temple" or "Frog Temple"
Since 1997 he has maintained a Forest Green Tree Frog observation web site. Local folk are fond of the temple which also goes by the popular names "Green Forest Temple" or "Frog Temple"
Since 1997 he has maintained a Forest Green Tree Frog observation web site.
sen.cmt: 「一原文一訳文の例外対処」余分なスペース消去

sen.j: 通称「モリアオ寺 カエル寺」として地域に親しまれている。
sen.e: Local folk are fond of the temple which also goes by the popular names 'Green Forest Temple or 'Frog Temple.'
sen.cmt: 「一原文一訳文の例外対処」クォーテーションをシングル・半角に修正、ピリオド追加

sen.j: 寺の裏山には古墳群がある。
sen.e: On the hill behind the temple is an old group of tumuli.
On the hill behind the temple is an old group of tumuli.
On the hill behind the temple is an old group of tumuli.

sen.j: 地域によっては生息地が天然記念物に指定されている、モリアオガエルが棲息しており毎年5月6月ごろには産卵している。
sen.e: This region thus supports an untold number of protected species habitats. The Forest Green Tree Frog inhabiting this area spawns around May or June each year.
This region thus supports an untold number of protected species habitats. The Forest Green Tree Frog inhabiting this area spawns around May or June each year.
The forest green tree frog, which habitats are designated as a natural monument in certain areas, inhabits this area and spawns around May or June each year.
sen.cmt: Forest Green Tree Frog→forest green tree frogとし、「(モリアオガエルの)生息地が天然記念物に指定されている」という原文の内容に沿うよう訳し直しました。

sen.j: モリアオガエル観察会を兼ねて6月第一日曜日午後１時よりには「モリアオコンサ－ト」も開催されている。
sen.e: The Forest Green Tree Frog observation club holds a "Green Forest Concert" at 1 PM on the first Sunday in June.
The Forest Green Tree Frog observation club holds a "Green Forest Concert" at 1 PM on the first Sunday in June.
The Forest Green Tree Frog observation club holds a 'Green Forest Concert' at 1 PM on the first Sunday in June.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションをシングル・半角に修正

sen.j: 「モリアオコンサ－ト」平成21年は6月7日(日)午後1時より開催
sen.e: The 2009 "Green Forest Concert" was held on June 7 from 1 PM.
The 2009 "Green Forest Concert" was held on June 7 from 1 PM.
The 2009 'Green Forest Concert' was held on June 7 (Sunday) from 1 PM.
sen.cmt: "(日)"を訳出、クォーテーションをシングル・半角に修正

sen.j: 日本固有種、アオガエル科 地域によっては生息地が天然記念物に指定され、保護されている。
sen.e: Green frogs are an endemic species to Japan and in specific areas designated habits are protected and preserved.
Green frogs are an endemic species to Japan and in specific areas designated habits are protected and preserved.
The forest green tree frog is an endemic species to Japan in the Rhacophoridae family; in specific areas its habitats are designated as a natural monument and protected.
sen.cmt: 原文の内容に沿わない部分を修正

sen.j: 本州と佐渡ケ島に生息し、北は青森県から山口県に生息している。
sen.e: They inhabit Honshu (the main island in the Japanese archipelago) and Sado island and are found from Aomori Prefecture in the North to Yamaguchi Prefecture.
They inhabit Honshu (the main island in the Japanese archipelago) and Sado island and are found from Aomori Prefecture in the North to Yamaguchi Prefecture.
They inhabit Honshu (the main island in the Japanese archipelago) and Sado island and are found from Aomori Prefecture in the North to Yamaguchi Prefecture.

sen.j: 日本海側に生息地が多いが、千葉や伊豆、静岡にも生息している。
sen.e: The majority of habitats are found adjacent to the Sea of Japan but they are also found in Chiba, Izu and Shizuoka.
The majority of habitats are found adjacent to the Sea of Japan but they are also found in Chiba, Izu and Shizuoka.
The majority of habitats are found adjacent to the Sea of Japan but they are also found in Chiba, Izu and Shizuoka Prefectures.
sen.cmt: Chiba, Izu and Shizuoka Prefecturesとしました。

sen.j: 寒さに強い種である。
sen.e: The species is resistant to cold weather.
The species is resistant to cold weather.
The species is resistant to cold weather.

sen.j: 環境変化により、生息地が減少している。
sen.e: There has been a decline in habitats due to environmental change.
There has been a decline in habitats due to environmental change.
There has been a decline in habitats due to environmental change.

sen.j: 同じアオガエル科のシュレ－ゲルアオガエルと間違えられることが多い。
sen.e: The Forest Green Tree Frog is often mistaken for the Schlegel's Green Tree Frog (Rhacophorus schlegelii) from the same green frog family. However, they can be differentiated by the loudness of their croaks and, color around the eyes.

The Forest Green Tree Frog is often mistaken for the Schlegel's Green Tree Frog (Rhacophorus schlegelii) from the same green frog family. However, they can be differentiated by the loudness of their croaks and, color around the eyes.
The forest green tree frog is often mistaken for the Schlegel's green tree frog (Rhacophorus schlegelii) from the same green frog family.
sen.cmt: 「一原文一訳文の例外対処」forest green tree frog、Schlegel's green tree frogとしました。

sen.j: しかし、鳴き声や大きさ、目の周りの色で区別できる。
sen.e: However, they can be differentiated by the loudness of their croaks and, color around the eyes.

sen.j: 「森青蛙」と表すように、森林、林に樹上生活しているので見つけることが難しい。
sen.e: In Chinese characters, the Forest Green Tree Frog is written as 森青蛙 (Moriaogaeru) indicating they live up in trees in forests and are hard to find. During the rainy season around June the frogs descend to ponds where they spawn by affixing white foamy floss-like clumps of eggs to branches of trees that brush the water surface.

In Chinese characters, the Forest Green Tree Frog is written as 森青蛙 (Moriaogaeru) indicating they live up in trees in forests and are hard to find. During the rainy season around June the frogs descend to ponds where they spawn by affixing white foamy floss-like clumps of eggs to branches of trees that brush the water surface.
In Chinese characters, the forest green tree frog is written as 森青蛙 (Moriaogaeru) indicating they live up in trees in forests and are hard to find.
sen.cmt: 「一原文一訳文の例外対処」forest green tree frogとしました。

sen.j: 6月ごろの梅雨時には、産卵池に下りて、池にそり出す樹木の枝に、綿帽子のような白い泡状の卵塊を付ける。
sen.e: During the rainy season around June the frogs descend to ponds where they spawn by affixing white foamy floss-like clumps of eggs to branches of trees that brush the water surface.

sen.j: 大興寺池では昭和20年ごろより、生息確認されている。
sen.e: The pond at Daikoji Temple has been an identified habitat since 1945.
The pond at Daikoji Temple has been an identified habitat since 1945.
The pond at Daiko-ji Temple has been an identified habitat since 1945.

sen.j: モリアオガエルの保護、観察のために毎年観察会を開催し、地域の皆さんや子供達に自然環境問題が及ぼす影響を理解していただいている。
sen.e: An observation event is held annually to observe and protect the Forest Green Tree Frog at which local residents and children can appreciate the impact of environmental issues on nature.
An observation event is held annually to observe and protect the Forest Green Tree Frog at which local residents and children can appreciate the impact of environmental issues on nature.
An observation event is held annually to observe and protect the forest green tree frog at which local residents and children can appreciate the impact of environmental issues on nature.
sen.cmt: forest green tree frogとしました。

sen.j: 現在の本堂は平成12年に老朽化した旧本堂を解体して再建された。
sen.e: The present main hall (Hondo) of the temple was rebuilt in the year 2000 to replace the former Hondo structure which had deteriorated and been demolished.
The present main hall (Hondo) of the temple was rebuilt in the year 2000 to replace the former Hondo structure which had deteriorated and been demolished.
The present Hondo (main hall) of the temple was rebuilt in the year 2000 to replace the former Hondo structure which had deteriorated and been demolished.
sen.cmt: ローマ字表記(英訳表記)の順にするため、main hall (Hondo)→Hondo (main hall)に修正

sen.j: 天井には植物の絵が掲げている。
sen.e: Images of plants are painted on the ceiling.
Images of plants are painted on the ceiling.
Images of plants are painted on the ceiling.

sen.j: 境内の鐘楼は現在梵鐘が無い。
sen.e: There is no bell in the belfry in the temple grounds.
There is no bell in the belfry in the temple grounds.
There is no bell in the belfry in the temple grounds.

sen.j: 昭和17年11月15日、戦時下の大東亜戦争 梵鐘供出のため岡山県宇野三菱鉱業精錬所に送られた。
sen.e: On November 15, 1942 during the Pacific War, as part of the war effort the bell was sent to Mitsubishi Mining Co. Ltd smelting works in Uno, Okayama Prefecture.
On November 15, 1942 during the Pacific War, as part of the war effort the bell was sent to Mitsubishi Mining Co. Ltd smelting works in Uno, Okayama Prefecture.
On November 15, 1942 during the Pacific War, as part of the war effort the bell was sent to Mitsubishi Mining Co. Ltd smelting works in Uno, Okayama Prefecture.

sen.j: 爾来堂宇のみ保存されていたが、檀信徒の願意により、平成22年4月には再鋳されることが、決定した。
sen.e: Since then, the structure has remained empty. However, following petitions by the congregation, a decision was made to recast the bell in April 2010.
Since then, the structure has remained empty. However, following petitions by the congregation, a decision was made to recast the bell in April 2010.
Since then, the structure has remained empty; however, following petitions by the congregation, a decision was made to recast the bell in April 2010.
sen.cmt: 二文に分かれているため、一文になるよう修正

sen.j: 京都府福知山市正明寺1771
sen.e: 1771 Shomyoji, Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture.
1771 Shomyoji, Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture.
1771 Shomyoji, Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture

sen.j: JR福知山駅徒歩30分 タクシ－8分
sen.e: 30 minutes on foot/8 minutes by taxi from JR Fukuchiyama Station.,
30 minutes on foot/8 minutes by taxi from JR Fukuchiyama Station.,
30 minutes on foot/8 minutes by taxi from JR Fukuchiyama Station

sen.j: 福知山城
sen.e: Fukuchiyama Castle
Fukuchiyama Castle

sen.j: 三段池公園
sen.e: Sandanike Lake Park
